outerKora.title: Outer Kora (Parikrama)
outerKora.description: The sacred circumambulation around Mount Kailash, one of the most spiritually significant pilgrimages in the world.

days.title: Darchen to Dirapuk
highlights: First glimpse of Kailash North Face
days.description: Begin at Darchen, passing the Tarboche flagpole where annual Saga Dawa festival occurs. Trek along the Lha Chu valley with stunning views of Kailash's magnificent north face.

days.title: Dirapuk to Zutulpuk
days.description: The most challenging day, crossing the sacred Dolma La Pass at 5,630m. Pilgrims believe this represents death and rebirth. Descend past Gauri Kund, sacred to Hindus.

days.title: Zutulpuk to Darchen
days.description: Easier day following the Zhong Chu river valley. Visit Zutulpuk Monastery with Milarepa's meditation cave. Complete the kora returning to Darchen.

innerKora.title: Inner Kora (Nandi Parikrama)
innerKora.description: A shorter, more intimate circuit closer to the mountain. Traditionally only attempted after completing 13 outer koras.
innerKora.note: This route is rarely undertaken and requires special spiritual preparation according to tradition.

lakeManasarovar.title: Lake Manasarovar Parikrama
lakeManasarovar.description: The sacred circumambulation of Lake Manasarovar, often combined with the Kailash Kora.
highlights: Views of both Kailash and Gurla Mandhata
